source: WHO Disease Outbreak News - Cholera in Mali update 2
processing_notes: Source states: 'total number of 1216 cases including 106 deaths (case fatality rate 8.72%)' - interpreted as sCh cases. Affected regions: Koulikoro Segou Mopti Tombouctou Sikasso Bamako

source: Mali: Cholera Outbreak - Jul 2011 ReliefWeb
processing_notes: Source states: 'Between 18-27 Jul 2011 a total of 258 cases including 20 deaths' - interpreted as sCh cases. Regions affected: Mopti and Tombouctou

source: Mali: Cholera Outbreak - Jul 2011 ReliefWeb
processing_notes: Source mentions Tombouctou region affected in 2011 outbreak but specific case numbers not provided for this region separately

source: Epidemic cholera in Mali 1984 - PubMed
processing_notes: Source states: '1793 cases and 406 deaths reported death-to-case ratio of 23%' - interpreted as sCh cases. Major epidemic with 23% case fatality rate during famine conditions

source: Cholera Epidemics in Mali between 1995 and 2004 - PubMed
processing_notes: Source states: '12176 cases of cholera including 1406 deaths from 1995 to 2004' - interpreted as sCh cases. Comprehensive surveillance data showing annual epidemics since 2001

source: Les épidémies de choléra au Mali de 1995 à 2004 - Cairn.info
processing_notes: Source states: '1996 was a year of cholera epidemic par excellence with cases recorded 11 months out of 12' - Mopti region most affected peak in October with 23.6% of cases

source: Les épidémies de choléra au Mali de 1995 à 2004 - Cairn.info
processing_notes: Source confirms Segou region among most impacted during 1996 major epidemic year. Two seasonal peaks: May (27.8% of cases) and August (17.1% of cases)

source: Mali cholera border Niger Burkina transmission - Academic Study
processing_notes: Source states: '2001: 68 cases were recorded' with CFR 14.7%. Beginning of annual epidemic pattern in Mali since 2001

source: Mali cholera border Niger Burkina transmission - Academic Study
processing_notes: Source states: '2002: 16 cases were recorded' with CFR 12.5%. Annual epidemic continuation pattern

source: Mali cholera border Niger Burkina transmission - Academic Study
processing_notes: Source states: '2004: 2860 cases were recorded' with CFR 6.9%. Major epidemic year in annual pattern

source: Mali cholera border Niger Burkina transmission - Academic Study
processing_notes: Source states: Koulikoro region had 99 cases in 2003 (6.9% of total national cases). Provincial breakdown data

source: Mali cholera border Niger Burkina transmission - Academic Study
processing_notes: Source states: Bamako district had 15 cases in 2003 (1% of total national cases). Capital city data

source: Mali cholera zero transmission validation 1997-1998
processing_notes: Source confirms 'From 1998 to 2000 no cholera cases were declared in Mali' - validated cholera-free period between 1995-1996 and 2001 epidemics. Surveillance system functioning

source: Seventh cholera pandemic introduction Mali 1970
processing_notes: Source states: 'In November 1970 infected individuals seemed to travel by modernised rapid transport. This allowed cholera to extend 1000 km when it appeared in Mopti Mali' - first appearance of cholera in Mali as part of seventh pandemic

source: MSF Mali cholera response historical
processing_notes: Source states: 'MSF reported a total of 693 cholera patients of whom 55 people died' - major humanitarian response along Niger River with cases in Ségou and Mopti regions

source: Mopti region MSF weekly cholera data 2011
processing_notes: Source states: '55 cases and five deaths recorded in Mopti in a single week' - weekly provincial-level data from MSF Dr. Paul Ngwakum

source: Mali regional cholera breakdown 1995-2004 geographic expansion
processing_notes: Source states: 'Mopti: 3412 cases (28% of total cases)' - regional breakdown showing Mopti as most affected region consistently across all epidemics 1995-2004

source: Mali regional cholera breakdown 1995-2004 geographic expansion
processing_notes: Source states: 'Tombouctou: 2686 cases (22.1% of total cases)' - regional breakdown showing second highest regional case burden 1995-2004

source: Mali regional cholera breakdown 1995-2004 geographic expansion
processing_notes: Source states: 'Gao: 790 cases (6.5% of total cases)' - regional breakdown for northern Mali Gao region 1995-2004 period

source: Gao region cholera 2012-2013 ICRC response
processing_notes: Source states: '32 cases of cholera were identified in the village of Wabaria situated along the Niger River near Gao in northern Mali with two deaths initially reported'

source: Gao region cholera 2012-2013 ICRC response
processing_notes: Source states: 'Six children died among 56 total cases reported in Wabaria Labbezanga and Ansongo in Gao region on the banks of the Niger River'

source: West Africa cholera outbreak 2020-2021 Mali impact
processing_notes: Source states: 'Mali was particularly severely affected with a case fatality ratio reaching 38.5%' - part of regional West Africa outbreak with extremely high CFR indicating severe epidemic conditions

source: Mali Kayes region cholera 1995-2004 single epidemic
processing_notes: Source states: 'Kayes region had one major epidemic with 3497 cases' representing 28.7% of national total - single large epidemic contrasts with multiple smaller outbreaks in other regions

source: Mali Sikasso region cholera 1995-2004 limited epidemics
processing_notes: Source states: 'Sikasso had two epidemics with 50 cases (0.4% of total)' - minimal cholera activity compared to other regions southern border location

source: Gao region cholera August 2012 expanded outbreak
processing_notes: Source states: 'authorities in Mali's Gao and Asongo districts have reported 147 cases and 12 deaths since early July' - expanded outbreak from initial 56 cases to district-wide spread

source: Mali cholera 1984 village-level transmission study
processing_notes: Source states: 'In four affected villages the mean clinical attack rate was 1.5 and 29% of affected persons died' - detailed village-level epidemiological analysis showing high case fatality in drought conditions

source: Mali cholera absence 2022-2024 WHO surveillance validation
processing_notes: Source confirms Mali absent from WHO global cholera surveillance reports 2022-2024 - validated absence via 'New cases have been reported from [27 countries]' with Mali not listed indicating zero cholera transmission

source: Mali absent 2024 WHO AFRO cholera outbreaks regional validation
processing_notes: Source confirms 'cholera outbreak in WHO African Region in 2024 has affected 14 countries... Mali not listed among affected countries' - validated regional absence while neighbors experienced outbreaks
